qas.question: How do birds navigate and orient themselves during migration?

answers.text: endogenous programs as well as learning

qas.question: What is a primitive trait present even in non migrating birds?
What is a complex phenomenon in regards to migration?

context: The control of <a2_0>migration<a2_0/>, its timing and response are genetically controlled and appear to be <a0_0>a primitive trait<a0_0/> that is present even in non-migratory species of birds. <a3_0>The ability to navigate<a3_0/> and orient themselves during migration is a much more complex phenomenon that may include both <a1_0>endogenous programs as well as learning<a1_0/>.
